intro.description:
Extraction rules are tools to transform HTML code (website language) to XML code. « extraction rules » are presented in all screen classes containing information to be extracted.
Words in bold in this example is available in (?).

item.title: Position the browser
item.description: Position the browser area on a screen containing the to be extracted information.

item.title: Verify if the web page corresponds with its screen class
item.description:
Verify if the page of the browser area is associated with the wanted screen. To do this press the icon Synchronize icon.
In the tab Project view, a screen class has been automatically selected : it is the screen class detected by Convertigo for the actual web page.

item.title: Position the information to be extracted in a green frame
item.description: For this, click right in the Browser area on one of the elements to be extracted followed by eventually making the frame larger with the help of the icon parent node icon .

item.title: Identify l'information by a Xpath
item.description:
Find in the DOM area by clicking right-->« Generate selection Xpath » a XPATH request identifying the green frame.
The result can be one or more elements depending on the needs.

item.title: Choose a rule d'extraction
item.description:
In function of the type of extraction information multiple rules can be choosen.
Cliquez sur (?) pour en voir la liste.
The rest of this help file describes two of the most used extraction rules.

item.title: L'exemple de la règle Text
item.description:
Extraction rule « Text » allows to recuperate Text an HTML marker .
To add this rule to a project, select the screen class wanted in the tab Projet view and press the icon new Extraction rules icon(The Xpath of the Xpath area mist be valid).

item.title: L'example of the Record rule
item.description:
The « Record » rule allows to extract information from a list (multiple elements returned by the Xpath request).
To add this rule to a project, select the screen class wanted in the tab Project view and press the icon new Extraction rules icon(The Xpath of the Xpath area must be valid).
In the tab Properties view you can see a line "Xpath" containing the request permitting to access the information to be extracted (must return a list). A treatment will be executed for each of the results of this request.
>Click on the line « Description» just below followed by the button « … ».
>Click on the blue icon for each elementary information in the element of the list.
> Give names corresponding to the information in the collumn « name » and in the collumn Xpath enter an Xpath request relative to the first onerez une requête Xpath relative to the first one leading to the wanted information.

item.title: Verify the working of your Extraction rules
item.description:
To verify that your extraction rules work well, click on the icon XMLize icon next look at the result in the tab Output Tab of the browser.
Attention the icon XMLize icon of this tab doesn't give the right result !!!
